basics.name: Jeffrey Balagosa
basics.summary: Experienced Desktop Support Manager with 18+ years of technical leadership and management skills. Seeking transition to Web Development. Proficient in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and Python, with a strong understanding of operating systems and network architecture. Skilled in project management and cross-functional collaboration. Passionate about learning new technologies and frameworks.
basics.headline: Professional IT Expert

items.name: Vegas.com
items.summary: • Developed custom tools to automate tasks and improve efficiency, leveraging programming languages such as JavaScript, Python, PowerShell, AutoHotkey, and Ansible. • Managed a desktop support team, motivating them to complete assigned tasks before deadlines. • Implemented and deployed endpoint management systems to ensure the smooth operation of company workstations. • Reviewed and provided technical support for team tickets and phone calls. • Conducted research, ordered, and deployed new hardware and software for desktop systems, printers, scanners, and other peripherals. • Maintained security updates for company workstations and non-production servers while ensuring that computing standards met PCI requirements for audits.

items.name: Vegas.com
items.summary: • Supervised a technical support team, ensuring timely resolution of user issues. • Deployed and managed endpoint management systems to optimize workstation performance. • Conducted regular reviews of technician tickets and phone calls to identify areas for improvement. • Researched and recommended new hardware and software for company workstations and peripherals. • Ensured timely implementation of security updates for company workstations and non-production servers. • Maintained computing standards following PCI requirements to support successful audits.

items.name: Vegas.com
items.summary: • Conducted troubleshooting on hardware and software systems to identify and resolve issues quickly. • Managed the deployment and replacement of hardware and software systems at corporate offices, hotels, and casinos. • Administered user accounts within Active Directory and Microsoft Exchange, ensuring proper access and security. • Researched and recommended new equipment and software, including desktop systems, printers, scanners, monitors, and other peripherals. • Ensured regular updates and backups of servers in a primarily Windows Server 2008 environment. • Installed, updated, and maintained server-based software to support efficient system performance. • Provisioned and deployed smartphones, including Blackberry, iPhone, and Android devices, for company use.

items.name: The Madrid Agency of Farmers Insurance
items.summary: •	Hiring and training of new employees. •	Lead generation for insuring local businesses and households. •	Telemarketing. •	Build relationships with center's of influence. •	Writing and Mailing Ad Copy. •	Appointment Setting. •	Customer Service. •	Closing 20 new business policies per month.

items.name: Vegas.com
items.summary: •	Performed second level troubleshooting on hardware & software systems problems. •	Deployed and replaced various hardware and software systems in the corporate offices as well as hotels and casinos. •	Created, managed, and deleted user accounts within Active Directory and Microsoft Exchange. •	Researched, ordered, and deployed new equipment and software.  Desktop systems, printers, scanners, monitors, peripherals, etc. •	Update and back up servers as needed.  Primarily in a Windows Server 2008 environment. •	Installed, updated, and maintained server based software. •	Provisioned and deployed smart phones, such as Blackberry, Iphone, and Android. •	Assisted in training new Desktop Support Technicians.

items.name: Vegas.com
items.summary: •	Performed first-level core troubleshooting on hardware & software systems problems. •	Answered questions, provided technical solutions, and followed up to assist users in solving their information systems problems in a continuous user-support environment. •	Documented user problems, resolution, and new solutions for future reference using helpdesk tools and resources, such as Frontrange and our own Proprietary Helpdesk Wiki. •	Assisted in identifying trends in continuing hardware, software or systems problems. •	Coordinated with other departments such as Systems Engineering, Network Engineering, and Production Support to resolve emergency companywide issues in a 24hr environment. •	Managed user accounts with Active Directory. •	Assisted in training new Helpdesk Technicians.

items.name: Starbucks Coffee Company
items.summary: **Performed first-level core troubleshooting on hardware & software **systems problems. **Answered questions, provided technical solutions, and followed up to assist users in solving their information systems problems in a continuous user-support environment. **Documented user problems, resolution, and new solutions for future reference using EHD tools and resources, such as Remedy and Primus. **Assisted in identifying trends in continuing hardware, software or systems problems. **Monitored and reported on store polling issues, regarding sales and payroll upload. **Assisted in training new EHD Analysts.

items.name: Starbucks Coffee Company
items.summary: •	Correspond with external consumers by acknowledging praises or offering service recovery for complaints. •	Achieved Q3 – 2004 Legendary Service Award & Bravo Award for facilitating CRM software rollout. •	Conducted department wide and new hire training on new customer relations management software & procedures. •	Develop new templates to incorporate the “You-Attitude” style of persuasive writing. •	Recommended on numerous occasions by supervisor to help train and solve light technical issues. •	Train new employees on Starbucks CRM procedures and software.
